intro: Scleranthus arenarius, commonly known as the sand senna, is a flowering plant native to arid and sandy environments. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal dunes and other dry, sandy soils, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are often narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss in hot, dry climates. Scleranthus arenarius is an important component of coastal ecosystems, contributing to soil stabilization and providing habitat for various insects and small animals.
